swDHCPRelayMIB.name: swDHCPRelayMIB
swDHCPRelayMIB.description: The structure of DHCP relay management for the proprietary enterprise.

swDHCPRelayState.name: swDHCPRelayState
swDHCPRelayState.description: This object indicates whether the DHCP relay function is enabled or disabled.

swDHCPRelayHopCount.name: swDHCPRelayHopCount
swDHCPRelayHopCount.description: This object indicates the maximum number of router hops that the BOOTP packets can cross.

swDHCPRelayTimeThreshold.name: swDHCPRelayTimeThreshold
swDHCPRelayTimeThreshold.description: This object indicates the minimum time in seconds within which the switch must relay the DHCP request. If this time is exceeded, the switch will drop the DHCP packet.

swDHCPRelayCtrlTable.name: swDHCPRelayCtrlTable
swDHCPRelayCtrlTable.description: This table indicates the IP address as a destination to forward (relay) DHCP packets to.

swDHCPRelayCtrlEntry.name: swDHCPRelayCtrlEntry
swDHCPRelayCtrlEntry.description: A list of information indicates the IP address as a destination to forward (relay) DHCP packets to.

swDHCPRelayCtrlInterfaceName.name: swDHCPRelayCtrlInterfaceName
swDHCPRelayCtrlInterfaceName.description: This object indicates the name of the IP interface.

swDHCPRelayCtrlServer.name: swDHCPRelayCtrlServer
swDHCPRelayCtrlServer.description: This object indicates the DHCP server IP address.

swDHCPRelayCtrlRowStatus.name: swDHCPRelayCtrlRowStatus
swDHCPRelayCtrlRowStatus.description: This object indicates the status of this entry.

swDHCPRelayOption82State.name: swDHCPRelayOption82State
swDHCPRelayOption82State.description: This object indicates whether the DHCP relay option 82 function is enabled or disabled.

swDHCPRelayOption82CheckState.name: swDHCPRelayOption82CheckState
swDHCPRelayOption82CheckState.description: This object indicates whether the DHCP relay option 82 check function is enabled or disabled.

swDHCPRelayOption82Policy.name: swDHCPRelayOption82Policy
swDHCPRelayOption82Policy.description: This object indicates the DHCP relay option 82 policy.

swDHCPRelayOption82RemoteIDType.name: swDHCPRelayOption82RemoteIDType
swDHCPRelayOption82RemoteIDType.description: This object indicates the type of remote ID. If the type is default,the remote ID will be the System's MAC address. If the type is user-defined, the remote ID can be defined by writing to the swDHCPRelayOption82RemoteID object. If the type is vendor2, the remote ID will be the System Name. If the type is vendor3, the remote ID will configured in swDHCPRelayOption82PerPortRemoteIdTable

swDHCPRelayOption82RemoteID.name: swDHCPRelayOption82RemoteID
swDHCPRelayOption82RemoteID.description: This object displays the current remote ID of the device. If swDHCPRelayOption82RemoteIDType is set to default, the value will be the MAC address of the device, and this object cannot be modified. If swDHCPRelayOption82RemoteIDType is set to vendor2, the remote ID will be theSystem Name., and this object cannot be modified.If swDHCPRelayOption82RemoteIDType is set to user-defined, a new value can be written to this object.

swDHCPRelayOption82CircuitIDType.name: swDHCPRelayOption82CircuitIDType
swDHCPRelayOption82CircuitIDType.description: This object indicates the type of circuit ID.If the type is default,the circuit ID will be the VLAN ID, Module ID and Port Number. If the type is user-defined ,the circuit ID can be defined by writing to the swDHCPRelayOption82CircuitId object.If the type is vendor1, the circuit ID will be the VLAN ID, Slot ID, Port Number and System's MAC address. If the type is vendor2, the circuit ID will be the Port Number.If the type is vendor3,the circuit ID will be configured in swDHCPRelayOption82PerPortCircuitIdTable If the type is vendor4, the circuit ID will be the System Name, Module ID, Port Number and Client VLAN ID. If the type is vendor5, the circuit ID will be the System Name, 'eth', Chassis ID, Slot ID, Port Number and Client VLAN ID. If the type is vendor6, the circuit ID will be the Port Name, VLAN ID, System Name, Slot ID, Sub Slot ID, Port Number.

swDHCPRelayOption82CircuitID.name: swDHCPRelayOption82CircuitID
swDHCPRelayOption82CircuitID.description: This object displays the current circuit ID of the device. If swDHCPRelayOption82CircuitIDType is set to user-defined, a new value can be written to this object. If swDHCPRelayOption82CircuitIdType is set to other, the value will be display and cannot be modified.

swDHCPRelayOption82PerPortRemoteIdTable.name: swDHCPRelayOption82PerPortRemoteIdTable
swDHCPRelayOption82PerPortRemoteIdTable.description: This table is used to manage the DHCP relay Option82 Remote ID for each client.And this configure will override the configure of swDHCPRelayOption82RemoteId for this client.

swDHCPRelayOption82PerPortRemoteIdEntry.name: swDHCPRelayOption82PerPortRemoteIdEntry
swDHCPRelayOption82PerPortRemoteIdEntry.description: This object lists indicates the DHCP relay Option82 Remote ID for each client.

swDHCPRelayOption82PerPortRemoteIdPortIn.name: swDHCPRelayOption82PerPortRemoteIdPortIndex
swDHCPRelayOption82PerPortRemoteIdPortIn.description: This object indicates the Client's port number.

swDHCPRelayOption82PerPortRemoteIdType.name: swDHCPRelayOption82PerPortRemoteIdType
swDHCPRelayOption82PerPortRemoteIdType.description: This object indicates the type of port's remote ID. If the type is vendor3, the remote ID can be defined by writing to the swDHCPRelayOption82PerPortRemoteIdValue object.

swDHCPRelayOption82PerPortRemoteIdValue.name: swDHCPRelayOption82PerPortRemoteIdValue
swDHCPRelayOption82PerPortRemoteIdValue.description: This object displays the current remote ID of the special port. If swDHCPRelayOption82PerPortRemoteIdType is set to vendor3,a new value can be written to this object.

swDHCPRelayOption82PerPortCircuitIdTable.name: swDHCPRelayOption82PerPortCircuitIdTable
swDHCPRelayOption82PerPortCircuitIdTable.description: This table is used to manage the DHCP relay Option82 Circuit ID for each client.And this configure will override the configure of swDHCPRelayOption82CircuitId for this client.

swDHCPRelayOption82PerPortCircuitIdEntry.name: swDHCPRelayOption82PerPortCircuitIdEntry
swDHCPRelayOption82PerPortCircuitIdEntry.description: This object lists indicates the DHCP relay Option82 Circuit ID for each client.

swDHCPRelayOption82PerPortCircuitIdPortI.name: swDHCPRelayOption82PerPortCircuitIdPortIndex
swDHCPRelayOption82PerPortCircuitIdPortI.description: This object indicates the module's port number.(1..Max port number in the module)

swDHCPRelayOption82PerPortCircuitIdType.name: swDHCPRelayOption82PerPortCircuitIdType
swDHCPRelayOption82PerPortCircuitIdType.description: This object indicates the type of client's circuit ID.If the type is vendor3,the circuit ID can be defined by writing to the swDHCPRelayOption82PerPortCircuitIdValue object.

swDHCPRelayOption82PerPortCircuitIdValue.name: swDHCPRelayOption82PerPortCircuitIdValue
swDHCPRelayOption82PerPortCircuitIdValue.description: This object displays the current circuit ID of client. If swDHCPRelayOption82PerPortCircuitIdType is set to vendor3, a new value can be written to this object.

swDHCPRelayOption60State.name: swDHCPRelayOption60State
swDHCPRelayOption60State.description: This object indicates whether the DHCP relay option 60 function is enabled or disabled.

swDHCPRelayOption60DefMode.name: swDHCPRelayOption60DefMode
swDHCPRelayOption60DefMode.description: This object indicates default mode that has no option 60 matching rules. relay (1): means to relay the packet to the IP address which is specified by swDHCPRelayOption60DefRelayIp. drop (2): means to drop the packet.

swDHCPRelayOption60DefTable.name: swDHCPRelayOption60DefTable
swDHCPRelayOption60DefTable.description: This table indicates the default relay servers for the packet that has no option 60 matching rules.

swDHCPRelayOption60DefEntry.name: swDHCPRelayOption60DefEntry
swDHCPRelayOption60DefEntry.description: A list of information indicates the default relay servers for the packet that has no option 60 matching rules.

swDHCPRelayOption60DefRelayIp.name: swDHCPRelayOption60DefRelayIp
swDHCPRelayOption60DefRelayIp.description: This object indicates the IP address of the default relay server.

swDHCPRelayOption60DefRowStatus.name: swDHCPRelayOption60DefRowStatus
swDHCPRelayOption60DefRowStatus.description: This object indicates the status of this entry.

swDHCPRelayOption60Table.name: swDHCPRelayOption60Table
swDHCPRelayOption60Table.description: This table indicates the relay servers for the packet for option 60 rules.

swDHCPRelayOption60Entry.name: swDHCPRelayOption60Entry
swDHCPRelayOption60Entry.description: A list of information indicates the relay servers for the packet for option 60 rules.

swDHCPRelayOption60String.name: swDHCPRelayOption60String
swDHCPRelayOption60String.description: This object indicates the string of this entry. Note that it is theoretically possible for a valid string to exceed the allowed length of an SNMP object identifier, and thus be impossible to represent in tables in this MIB that are indexed by string.

swDHCPRelayOption60RelayIp.name: swDHCPRelayOption60RelayIp
swDHCPRelayOption60RelayIp.description: This object indicates the IP address of the relay server.

swDHCPRelayOption60MatchType.name: swDHCPRelayOption60MatchType
swDHCPRelayOption60MatchType.description: This object indicates the match state of this entry. exact (1): Means the option 60 string in the packet must fully match the specified string. partial (2): Means the option 60 string in the packet only needs to partially match the specified string.

swDHCPRelayOption60RowStatus.name: swDHCPRelayOption60RowStatus
swDHCPRelayOption60RowStatus.description: This object indicates the status of this entry.

swDHCPRelayOption61State.name: swDHCPRelayOption61State
swDHCPRelayOption61State.description: This object indicates whether the DHCP relay option 61 function is enabled or disabled.

swDHCPRelayOption61DefMode.name: swDHCPRelayOption61DefMode
swDHCPRelayOption61DefMode.description: This object indicates the default mode has no option 61 matching rules. relay (1): Means to relay the packet to the IP address which is specified by swDHCPRelayOption61DefRelayIp. drop (2): Means to drop the packet.

swDHCPRelayOption61DefRelayIp.name: swDHCPRelayOption61DefRelayIp
swDHCPRelayOption61DefRelayIp.description: This object indicates the IP address of the default relay server has no option 61 matching rules. Pay attention to when swDHCPRelayOption61Mode is: relay (1): This object must be set together. drop (2): This object can not be set, and it always returns to '0.0.0.0'.

swDHCPRelayOption61Table.name: swDHCPRelayOption61Table
swDHCPRelayOption61Table.description: This table indicates the relay servers for the packet for option 61 rules.

swDHCPRelayOption61Entry.name: swDHCPRelayOption61Entry
swDHCPRelayOption61Entry.description: A list of information indicates the relay servers for the packet for option 61 rules.

swDHCPRelayOption61ClientType.name: swDHCPRelayOption61ClientType
swDHCPRelayOption61ClientType.description: This object indicates the client type of this entry. mac (1): Means the client-ID which is the MAC address of a client. string (2): Means the client-ID which is specified string by an administrator.

swDHCPRelayOption61ClientID.name: swDHCPRelayOption61ClientID
swDHCPRelayOption61ClientID.description: This object indicates the string of this entry. Note: When the swDHCPRelayOption61ClientType is mac (1), the format of this object should be XX.XX.XX.XX.XX.XX (MAC address). When the swDHCPRelayOption61ClientType is string (2), it is theoretically possible for a valid string to exceed the allowed length of an SNMP object identifier, and thus be impossible to represent in tables in this MIB that are indexed by the string.

swDHCPRelayOption61Mode.name: swDHCPRelayOption61Mode
swDHCPRelayOption61Mode.description: This object indicates mode of this entry. relay (1): Means to relay the packet to the IP address which is specified by swDHCPRelayOption61RelayIp. drop (2): Means to drop the packet.

swDHCPRelayOption61RelayIp.name: swDHCPRelayOption61RelayIp
swDHCPRelayOption61RelayIp.description: This object indicates the IP address of the relay server. Pay attention to when swDHCPRelayOption61Mode is: relay (1): This object must be set together. drop (2): This object can not be set, and it always returns to '0.0.0.0'.

swDHCPRelayOption61RowStatus.name: swDHCPRelayOption61RowStatus
swDHCPRelayOption61RowStatus.description: This object indicates the status of this entry.

swDHCPRelayVlanCtrlTable.name: swDHCPRelayVlanCtrlTable
swDHCPRelayVlanCtrlTable.description: This table indicates the IP address as a destination to forward (relay) DHCP packets to.

swDHCPRelayVlanCtrlEntry.name: swDHCPRelayVlanCtrlEntry
swDHCPRelayVlanCtrlEntry.description: A list of information indicates the IP address as a destination to forward (relay) DHCP packets to.

swDHCPRelayVlanCtrlServer.name: swDHCPRelayVlanCtrlServer
swDHCPRelayVlanCtrlServer.description: This object indicates the DHCP server IP address.

swDHCPRelayVlanCtrlVlanRangeList1to64.name: swDHCPRelayVlanCtrlVlanRangeList1to64
swDHCPRelayVlanCtrlVlanRangeList1to64.description: This object indicates the VLAN range (1-512) that added the specific server.

swDHCPRelayVlanCtrlVlanRangeList65to128.name: swDHCPRelayVlanCtrlVlanRangeList65to128
swDHCPRelayVlanCtrlVlanRangeList65to128.description: This object indicates the VLAN range (513-1024) that added the specific server.

swDHCPRelayVlanCtrlVlanRangeList129to192.name: swDHCPRelayVlanCtrlVlanRangeList129to192
swDHCPRelayVlanCtrlVlanRangeList129to192.description: This object indicates the VLAN range (1025-1536) that added the specific server.

swDHCPRelayVlanCtrlVlanRangeList193to256.name: swDHCPRelayVlanCtrlVlanRangeList193to256
swDHCPRelayVlanCtrlVlanRangeList193to256.description: This object indicates the VLAN range (1537-2048) that added the specific server.

swDHCPRelayVlanCtrlVlanRangeList257to320.name: swDHCPRelayVlanCtrlVlanRangeList257to320
swDHCPRelayVlanCtrlVlanRangeList257to320.description: This object indicates the VLAN range (2049-2560) that added the specific server.

swDHCPRelayVlanCtrlVlanRangeList321to384.name: swDHCPRelayVlanCtrlVlanRangeList321to384
swDHCPRelayVlanCtrlVlanRangeList321to384.description: This object indicates the VLAN range (2561-3072) that added the specific server.

swDHCPRelayVlanCtrlVlanRangeList385to448.name: swDHCPRelayVlanCtrlVlanRangeList385to448
swDHCPRelayVlanCtrlVlanRangeList385to448.description: This object indicates the VLAN range (3073-3584) that added the specific server.

swDHCPRelayVlanCtrlVlanRangeList449to512.name: swDHCPRelayVlanCtrlVlanRangeList449to512
swDHCPRelayVlanCtrlVlanRangeList449to512.description: This object indicates the VLAN range (3585-4096) that added the specific server.

swDHCPRelayVlanCtrlRowStatus.name: swDHCPRelayVlanCtrlRowStatus
swDHCPRelayVlanCtrlRowStatus.description: This object indicates the status of this entry.

swDHCPRelayPortStateCtrlTable.name: swDHCPRelayPortStateCtrlTable
swDHCPRelayPortStateCtrlTable.description: This table is used to manage the DHCP relay state for each port.

swDHCPRelayPortStateCtrlEntry.name: swDHCPRelayPortStateCtrlEntry
swDHCPRelayPortStateCtrlEntry.description: This object lists the current ports in the switch and their corresponding DHCP relay state.

swDHCPRelayPortStateCtrlPortIndex.name: swDHCPRelayPortStateCtrlPortIndex
swDHCPRelayPortStateCtrlPortIndex.description: This object indicates the module's port number.(1..Max port number in the module)

swDHCPRelayPortStateCtrlState.name: swDHCPRelayPortStateCtrlState
swDHCPRelayPortStateCtrlState.description: This object indicates the state of the DHCP relay of each port.

swDHCPRelaySendArpByCidTable.name: swDHCPRelaySendArpByCidTable
swDHCPRelaySendArpByCidTable.description: This table is used to manage the DHCP relay send ARP to DHCP Server include the inner vid.

swDHCPRelaySendArpByCidEntry.name: swDHCPRelaySendArpByCidEntry
swDHCPRelaySendArpByCidEntry.description: This object lists the current each DHCP Server configuration inner vid.

swDHCPRelaySendArpByCidInnerVid.name: swDHCPRelaySendArpByCidInnerVid
swDHCPRelaySendArpByCidInnerVid.description: This object indicates the inner vid or null vid. 0: not insert inner vid. 1-4094: inner vid.

swDHCPLocalRelayGlobalState.name: swDHCPLocalRelayGlobalState
swDHCPLocalRelayGlobalState.description: This object indicates the state of the DHCP local relay function of the switch.

swDHCPLocalRelayVlanTable.name: swDHCPLocalRelayVlanTable
swDHCPLocalRelayVlanTable.description: This table is used to manage the DHCP local relay status for each VLAN.

swDHCPLocalRelayVlanEntry.name: swDHCPLocalRelayVlanEntry
swDHCPLocalRelayVlanEntry.description: This object lists the current VLANs in the switch and their corresponding DHCP local relay status.

swDHCPLocalRelayVlanID.name: swDHCPLocalRelayVlanID
swDHCPLocalRelayVlanID.description: This object indicates the VLAN ID.

swDHCPLocalRelayState.name: swDHCPLocalRelayState
swDHCPLocalRelayState.description: This object indicates the state of the DHCP relay function of the specified VLAN.

swDHCPLocalRelayOption82Table.name: swDHCPLocalRelayOption82Table
swDHCPLocalRelayOption82Table.description: This table is used to manage the DHCP local relay option 82 policy for each port.

swDHCPLocalRelayOption82Entry.name: swDHCPLocalRelayOption82Entry
swDHCPLocalRelayOption82Entry.description: This object lists the current ports in the switch and their corresponding DHCP local relay option 82 policy.

swDHCPLocalRelayOption82PortIndex.name: swDHCPLocalRelayOption82PortIndex
swDHCPLocalRelayOption82PortIndex.description: This object indicates the module's port number.(1..Max port number in the module)

swDHCPLocalRelayOption82Policy.name: swDHCPLocalRelayOption82Policy
swDHCPLocalRelayOption82Policy.description: This object indicates the policy of the DHCP local relay option 82 of each port.
